intro: Verbascum nihatgoekyigitii, commonly known as the Nihat Gökçiyiğit mullein, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which includes species known for their fuzzy, woolly leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
